to leave/to depart/to separate/to distinguish/to classify/other/another/don't ...!/to pin/to stick (sth) in

sentences.english: This woman just finished the farewell ceremony for his husband, came back home to want to accept a letter.
sentences.chinese: 这位妇女刚为他先生办完告别式，一回到家想收个信。

sentences.english: Billy:Are there any customs when attending a Taiwanese funeral?
sentences.chinese: 参加台湾的告别式有什么习俗吗？

definition: to offer condolences (for the deceased)/to condole
Kaohsiung or Gaoxiong city and county in south Taiwan
(of a singer) autograph session/record signing event
to offer flowers/to lay flowers (as a memorial)
to make a speech/to make some remarks
Pingtung city, county and military airbase in south Taiwan
James Soong (1942-), Taiwanese politician expelled from Guomindang in 2000 when he founded People First Party 親民黨|亲民党
